content: Hi, I have successfully deployed dataverse in my VM and I would like to work on the part of datatags data categorization hierarchy, how can I see the effect in the platform? I see that there is very little about this part in the official guidance document.
I'm not sure Datatags are already implemented!
It's been in planning for a long time...
Not much activity in https://github.com/IQSS/DataTaggingLibrary
It's still on the list though: https://github.com/IQSS/dataverse-pm/issues/148
Would you like to work on that?
We always appreciate new contributors!
So what you're saying is that the part of the dataverse that I deployed following the tutorial doesn't village the presence of datatags?

We should wait for @Philip Durbin to wake up (~4-5h from now) for reference. As far as I know, DataTags are not yet supported in Dataverse. There is support for labels, but that might not be what you want/need.
Do you know how this project code is used for deployment, please?https://github.com/IQSS/DataTaggingLibrary

Sorry, I don't know anything about that code. Maybe @Philip Durbin has a few pointers. https://datatags.org seems dead. https://privacytools.seas.harvard.edu/datatags seems outdated. Seems like the idea is still out there but maybe will never be fully implemented.

If you are interested in storing sensitive data in a Dataverse installation, there is a working group. Not sure how active they are and it's not easy to get on the Slack instance because Slack. I know that @Johannes D and @Vera Clemens are dealing with sensitive health data.
Anyway, thank you for your help.
The last working group meeting was in January online and in March at the Dataverse Community Meeting. Sounds like they are still going!
https://groups.google.com/g/dataverse-community/c/MQANbw_AoHQ/m/hkJOhLrBAwAJ
Feel free to reach out to them via the mailing list https://groups.google.com/g/dataverse-community

i get a question:https://groups.google.com/g/dataverse-community/c/-qhu384a5h8/m/rNFSPyPFBQAJ According to denny's description, the datatags feature is built into the dataverse 5.0 and up can it be interpreted that way?
That is very outdated information. Dataverse 5.0 was released mid 2020 and never contained this implementation. The email you're referring to is from 2017... :wink:
DataTags was never released. Yes there is a new working group for sensitive data
I would suggest joining it
https://www.gdcc.io/working-groups.html
Is there an opportunity for me to join the datatags research programme to do some development and pioneering based on the current research content and progress?
On one of the pages I sent above there was a list of people involved. Maybe the PI is still around?
@Philip Durbin might know other folks at IQSS that are/were involved
You are always welcome to join the Dataverse Community as a contributor! We appreciate people putting together new solutions.

Given the size of the problem and amount of effort needed to pull it of, it would probably be a good idea to come up with some design ideas first and discuss them with the sensitive data working group.
This is an open source project and people joining working groups that can actually contribute time are very welcome! :innocent:
@charles wei I'm asking but I still think the best way to contribute at this point is to join the sensitive data working group.
Thanks for the reply, but I see that there seems to be a fee to join the group, which is a lot of money for me, anyway, thanks for your help!
@charles wei oh, sorry for the confusion. There is no fee to join a working group!
You're right that there is a fee to join the GDCC as a member organization, but (again) there is no fee to join working groups.
@Philipp Conzett do you think we should put a note about this on the working groups page?
But if I want to join the group I have to pay a membership fee right, maybe there are other ways to join the work that don't cost anything? I'm still working on my masters and have no income

@charles wei there is no fee to join the sensitive data working group. I checked with the organizer and she gave me this link to pass along to you: https://join.slack.com/t/dataversecommunity/shared_invite/zt-2gy9hvfwi-wDp5XMdi9usSthYTlSdchQ
Thank you very much.
Sure. I appreciate your interest and willingness to help! DataTags was a hot topic many years ago but development has slowed.

Philip Durbin said:

Philipp Conzett do you think we should put a note about this on the working groups page?

Yes, I think that would be useful. What about adding the following text on top of the Working Groups page?:

Everyone is welcome to join our groups. No (GDCC) fee is required to join a group.

@Philipp Conzett thanks, I just created https://github.com/gdcc/dataversecommunity.global/pull/5

If it looks ok, please go ahead and merge it.
@Philipp Conzett thanks for merging!

@charles wei https://www.gdcc.io/working-groups.html looks better now. No fee for joining a group:

Screenshot-2024-04-17-at-9.48.52-AM.png
@charles wei the next sensitive data working group meeting was just announced: https://groups.google.com/g/dataverse-community/c/dIdJA9wgLg8/m/xIEdLAEkAwAJ
